etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French epitaphe, via Latin from Greek epitaphion ‘funeral oration’, neuter of ephitaphios ‘over or at a tomb’, from epi ‘upon’ + taphos ‘tomb’

definitions: a phrase or form of words written in memory of a person who has died, especially as an inscription on a tombstone.
shortDefinitions: phrase written in memory of person who has died

definitions: something by which a person, time, or event will be remembered

examples.text: the story makes a sorry epitaph to a great career

shortDefinitions: something by which person, time, or event will be remembered
